title: Pope Francis in critical condition after severe respiratory crisis, Vatican says
summary: Pope Francis remains in critical condition after suffering a prolonged asthmatic respiratory crisis amid a complex lung infection, the Vatican announced Saturday. The 88-year-old pontiff, who is conscious but in pain, is receiving high-flow oxygen and blood transfusions as doctors monitor the risk of sepsis, a potentially fatal complication.

title: In Israel, the tragedy of the Bibas family overshadows the release of six hostages
summary: Hamas released six men, two of whom had been held in Gaza for over 10 years, while Israel was to release 620 Palestinian prisoners. The exact circumstances surrounding the death of Shiri Bibas, whose body has been returned, and her two young children remain unclear.

title: 'Act of terror' leaves one dead, two injured in eastern France
summary: A knife attack in the eastern French city of Mulhouse left one person dead and two police officers seriously wounded on Saturday, with President Emmanuel Macron denouncing it as an 'Islamist terror act.' The suspect, a 37-year-old Algerian man on a terror watchlist, was taken into custody.

title: France says escaped convict in prison van attack arrested in Romania
summary: Mohamed Amra had vanished without a trace after an attack with military-grade assault weapons on a prison van carrying him in the Normandy region.

title: Paris' Musée Picasso brings Nazi-hated art to light
summary: Based on recent discoveries, the Parisian museum evokes the defamatory exhibition organized in Munich in 1937 at Hitler's request, bringing together works stigmatized by the Third Reich in a new exhibition that opened on February 18.

title: A look back at Germany's lightning election campaign
summary: Triggered after the breakdown of the coalition led by Social Democrat Chancellor Olaf Scholz, the campaign for the February 23 parliamentary elections has been marked by terror attacks and interference from the Trump administration.

title: Brazil's Lula grapples with opposing climate and economic goals
summary: Brazil's president has positioned himself as a leader in the green transition for developing countries and has implemented multiple decarbonization measures. However, he also supports an energy policy based on fossil fuel extraction, seen as essential for the country's economic development.

title: Documentary describing how PM Orban's family became so wealthy attracts millions of viewers in Hungary
summary: 'The Dynasty' effectively traces how those close to the Hungarian prime minister have become miraculously wealthy alongside his political career for at least 15 years.

title: Trump orders tighter curbs on Chinese investments in key sectors
summary: The US president signed a memo calling for curbs on Chinese investments in sectors like technology, critical infrastructure and health care. Beijing said that the move was 'discriminatory.'

title: Behind the words of JD Vance's historic Munich speech
summary: On February 14, at the Munich Security Conference, US Vice President JD Vance violently attacked European democracy.  Le Monde publishes his speech in full, with added context and explanation.

title: Arab countries outline plan for rebuilding Gaza
summary: Ahead of an Arab League summit on March 4, representatives from the Gulf States, Egypt and Jordan discussed a plan for rebuilding the enclave in three stages, and for governance without Hamas or the Palestinian Authority.

title: 'Forced abroad, Russian oligarchs are repatriating their money and investing it in luxury real estate in Moscow'
summary: The price of high-end housing in the Russian capital rose by more than 20% in 2024 and is now approaching €20,000 per square meter, writes Le Monde's Philippe Escande in his column.

title: Starlink conquers the African internet market
summary: Elon Musk's satellite operator is multiplying its partnerships on the continent with the world's poorest web coverage, raising the fears of local operators and certain governments.

title: Argentina: A country that has become expensive for everyone, from locals to tourists and businesses
summary: The peso rose sharply against the dollar in 2024, causing a significant drop in tourism. The government maintains it will not devalue the currency.

title: Elephant seals, sentinels of the ocean's depths
summary: The population fluctuations of these marine mammals reveal a connection between the abundance of their prey and biophysical oscillations in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Steve Bannon after Jordan Bardella's Washington speech cancelled: 'It means he's not fit to lead'
summary: The RN president canceled his appearance at CPAC after a 'gesture alluding to Nazi ideology' performed by the former special adviser to Donald Trump.

title: Agriculture: A different model is possible
summary: Farmers' anger is often the expression of a legitimate feeling of abandonment by public authorities. Rather than give in to the demagoguery of a return to the past, we need to encourage initiatives to adapt to climate change.

title: Anthropologist Michel Agier: 'Biological race does not exist, but race produced by racism does exist socially'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the anthropologist analyzes the underlying racist mentality which, in his view, is part of Europe's colonial and imperial history.

title: Israel suspends release of Palestinians after six captives returned from Gaza
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced Sunday that the release of Palestinian prisoners, part of a ceasefire agreement with Hamas, will be delayed, citing alleged violations of the deal by the militant group. Hamas, who on Saturday released six more Israeli captives, has denied these accusations.

title: Musk orders US federal workers to justify jobs or face dismissal after Trump pushes for cuts
summary: Elon Musk, the advisor and biggest donor to US President Donald Trump, is demanding that all federal employees justify their work or risk losing their jobs. The directive, sent via email from the Office of Personnel Management, asked workers to submit a list of weekly accomplishments.

title: Ireland clinches Triple Crown as England edges Scotland in Six Nations drama
summary: Ireland kept their Six Nations title defense alive with a hard-fought 27-18 win over Wales, securing the Triple Crown thanks to Sam Prendergast’s precision kicking and impact performances from Bundee Aki and James Ryan off the bench. Meanwhile, England narrowly defeated Scotland 16-15 in a tense Calcutta Cup clash at Twickenham, with Finn Russell’s missed conversion in the final minute proving decisive.

title: How Elon Musk is applying the same brutal methods with the US federal government as with Twitter
summary: Drastic budget cuts, a commando mission by a small group of loyal followers, accusations of 'fraud'... The billionaire is trying to replicate the same procedures in the US administration as he used when taking control of the social network.

title: Raphaël Glucksmann, MEP: 'The small steps favored by European leaders are no longer enough, we need a giant leap'
summary: Under threat from Putin's Russia and their former ally the USA, European countries now have no other choice for their security and survival than to make the European Union a political, military and economic power, argues the social democrat MEP in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: Pedestrianization projects around Paris' landmarks spark tensions
summary: Trocadéro, Butte Montmartre, Concorde... As her term in office comes to an end, Paris mayor Anne Hidalgo is pursuing her policy of redeveloping public space, not without a few clashes.

title: Funding from a dictator and suitcases of cash: Why is former Nicolas Sarkozy on trial?
summary: The former French president is currently on trial over accusations that late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi funded his victorious 2007 presidential campaign.

title: Germany: What to know about the February 23 elections
summary: Amid a tense political backdrop, marked by polls favoring the far right, Germany's early parliamentary elections will serve to test the new proportional representation system established last July.

title: Macron's warnings at the Paris Agricultural Show: 'There's no guarantee that food won't become a weapon tomorrow'
summary: On Saturday, the French president opened the annual agricultural event in a calm atmosphere, unlike the event last year. Making his rounds and meeting people, he repeatedly warned of the consequences of the current geopolitical situation.

title: After Islamist knife attack in Mulhouse, French interior minister blames Algiers
summary: The French interior minister has accused the Algerian authorities of having refused 10 times a pass allowing the deportation of Brahim A., 37, suspected of stabbing a person to death and wounding five police officers in Mulhouse on Saturday. The man has 'a schizophrenic profile,' said the minister.

title: Germans vote amid far-right surge and looming threats from Trump
summary: The frontrunner, conservative candidate Friedrich Merz, has vowed a tough rightward shift if elected to win back voters from the anti-immigration AfD, which is eyeing a record result.

title: After three years of war in Ukraine, many Russians take refuge in an 'inner black box'
summary: In Moscow, psychologists describe the struggles of those who lead parallel and contradictory lives, torn between implicit support for the Kremlin and hidden opposition to its 'special military operation' in Ukraine.

title: Sex nerds: 'I had to justify myself at least 20 times explaining that, no, sex toys weren't "my thing"'
summary: According to the results of an Inserm-ANRS survey unveiled at the end of 2024, French people's sexuality has become much more diverse in recent years. But the multiplication of possibilities and practices is sometimes experienced as an injunction to perform, and makes those who don't explore them fear being considered out of the game.

title: In the land of junk food, the FDA proposes a front-of-pack nutrition label
summary: As almost 75% of US adults are overweight or obese, the US Food and Drug Administration has announced a simple, mandatory label to highlight quantities of saturated fats, sodium and added sugars. It remains to be seen if the regulation will be upheld in the Trump era.

title: Alice Weidel: Germany's far-right candidate backed by the Trump administration
summary: In a relationship with a woman of foreign origin, the AfD leader nonetheless assumes an anti-immigration rhetoric and unabashedly makes references to the Third Reich. This position has earned her the endorsement of Elon Musk and US Vice President JD Vance, while her party is credited with more than 20% of voting intentions in the February 23 parliamentary elections.

title: Save Gaza to save Europe
summary: It's not too late to realize that the fate of European integration is intimately linked to that of the Palestinian enclave, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Zelensky offers to resign in exchange for Ukrainian NATO membership
summary: Zelensky also said he wants to meet with Donald Trump before the US president meets his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. His remarks come on the eve of the third anniversary of Russia's invasion.

title: Macron to visit Washington, hoping to use 'unique' relationship to sway Trump
summary: In a trip to Washington on Monday, the French president is expected to urge Donald Trump to consider the safety of America's allies in the talks with Vladimir Putin.

title: Increasingly progressive women and conservative men: Why the ideological divide is widening among young people
summary: Far from their reputation as 'woke,' the younger generations are divided on feminist issues, which is reflected in their political affiliation, notes political scientist Anja Durovic.

title: Ukraine: behind Donald Trump's recent anger, Volodymyr Zelensky's refusal to cede strategic mineral exploitation
summary: The American president's cascade of contemptuous remarks, threats and lies this week has much to do with the Ukrainian subsoil: Zelensky has refused to sign a draft agreement on these minerals, an affront to the White House.

title: Germany's conservatives led by Merz win election, far-right AfD follows in second
summary: The conservative CDU/CSU alliance led by Friedrich Merz won Sunday's elections with between 28.5 and 29 percent of the vote, according to first TV exit polls. The far-right AfD followed in second place with 19.5 to 20 percent.

title: France arrests 10 linked to gang leader's escape, with Romania set to extradite him
summary: The Paris chief prosecutor said those arrested are alleged to have helped in the escape of Mohamed Amra in a deadly prison van ambush nine months ago.

title: France hammers Italy 73-24 in Six Nations with 11-try masterclass
summary: Les Bleus are now three points behind Ireland after bouncing back convincingly from their narrow and painful defeat at the hands of England.

title: Culture, Ukraine's other existential battle
summary: Since the start of the Russian invasion, Ukrainian authorities and artists have been mobilizing to build a national narrative, sparking heated debates ranging from total rejection to a desire for reappropriation.

title: 15 great-value restaurants for lunch in and around Paris
summary: From Latino restaurants to vegetarian canteens, French gastronomy to Roman specialties, here's our selection of gourmet eateries at reasonable prices.
